intro: Brossaea fragrantissima, commonly known as the sweet sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. It is valued for its aromatic roots, which have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Brossaea fragrantissima thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade in its natural habitat.
